title: What did humans look like 100,000,000 years ago? - Quora

response.answer_text: If evolutionary biologists are correct, homo sapiens looked something like... Actually, we don't know for sure, but primates didn't even exist 100 million years ago. Our ancestors probably looked something like a rodent, and even this isn't 100 million years ago, it's more like 45 to 60 million years. Five Early Primates You Should Know  Bear in mind that the dinosaurs went extinct about 65 million years ago, so you're asking about a date 35 million years in advance of that. Science fiction stuff. FYI, this never happened.

Humans didn’t exist during that time, in fact most of the modern mammals we know of today didn’t even exist yet. 100 million years ago the earth was dominated by dinosaurs and mammals existed in their shadows as tiny mouse-like creatures that probably lived in burrows or in trees like modern gophers and squirrels. They were likely easy prey for any small carnivorous dinosaurs that lived near them, so because of this, they were probably had a nocturnal lifestyle similar to that of bush babies and lemurs.
